components.name: Accordion
components.description: Vertically stacked content sections that expand or collapse to show or hide related content. Useful for progressive disclosure and minimizing page scroll.
a11yNotes: Use proper heading hierarchy
Announce expanded/collapsed state with aria-expanded or native <details>
Keyboard navigable via Tab and Enter/Space
Focus visible on active summary/header

components.name: Banner
components.description: Provides global or system-level messages to inform users about the status of an application or site. Banners range from low to critical importance and may include dismiss and follow-up actions.
a11yNotes: Use role='alert' for important messages
Dismissible banners need keyboard access
Announce to screen readers when appearing
Include aria-live region for updates

components.name: Breadcrumbs
components.description: A supplemental navigation element that shows users their current location within a site or app and allows quick navigation across multiple layers of hierarchy.
a11yNotes: Use nav element with aria-label
Current page should have aria-current='page'
Use aria-hidden='true' on visual separators between breadcrumb items
Ensure breadcrumb links are keyboard accessible via Tab and Shift+Tab

components.name: Button
components.description: A clickable element used to trigger actions. Buttons typically contain text, icons, or both and are used in dialogs, forms, and content sections to communicate a clear call to action.
a11yNotes: Use clear, descriptive text inside buttons to convey purpose
Ensure visible focus indicators on keyboard navigation
Use the native disabled attribute so screen readers announce the state
Icon-only buttons need aria-label for screen reader accessibility

components.name: Checkbox
components.description: An interactive input element that allows users to select one or more options from a list. Commonly used in forms, filters, and settings where multiple selections are allowed.
a11yNotes: Associate each checkbox input with a label using for and id
Group related checkboxes using fieldset and legend (legend may be visually hidden)
Use native checkbox inputs so screen readers announce state changes
Press Space to toggle checkbox selection

components.name: Selection Chip
components.description: Compact, interactive UI elements that represent options or filters. Selection chips allow users to make choices from a set of options, often used in filter groups, tag selectors, or multi-select UIs.
a11yNotes: Use nav element with aria-label
Current page should have aria-current='page'
Use aria-hidden='true' on visual separators between breadcrumb items
Ensure breadcrumb links are keyboard accessible via Tab and Shift+Tab

components.name: Combobox
components.description: A hybrid input that combines a text field and a dropdown list, allowing users to either select from a list of predefined options or input custom text. Commonly used for filtering, search, or selection tasks.
a11yNotes: Use aria-live or status role to announce number of available results
Up/Down arrow keys open the menu and move focus between options
Escape key closes the dropdown and clears inline autocomplete
Enter selects focused option and fills input field

components.name: Content Card
components.description: A customizable container that groups related content, icons, and actions. Often used to preview or summarize a topic, encourage user engagement, and support click-through to more detailed content.
a11yNotes: Wrap each card in an <article> or <section> element for semantic structure
Use semantic heading elements and maintain logical heading hierarchy
Ensure interactive cards have visible focus styles and are keyboard accessible
Provide meaningful alt text for card images
Avoid generic button or link labels; use aria-labels for context when repeated

components.name: Date Selector
components.description: A calendar-based input component that allows users to select or enter a specific date. Often used in forms to collect date-based input while saving space and providing a clear, localized experience.
a11yNotes: Support full keyboard navigation within the calendar grid (arrows, Home/End, Page Up/Down)
Announce selected date via live region or update input field with selected value
Include date format instructions in the label or via aria-describedby
Allow manual date entry for screen reader and keyboard users

components.name: Dialog
components.description: A modal container that interrupts the user's workflow to present time-sensitive information, confirm actions, or prompt for quick decisions. Dialogs are used to communicate alerts, statuses, or immediate options and are layered over the current page with an overlay.
a11yNotes: Trap keyboard focus within the dialog while open
Pressing Escape closes the dialog
Return focus to the triggering element when dialog closes
Ensure background content is hidden from screen readers while dialog is open (e.g., aria-hidden)

components.name: Dropdown Menu
components.description: A compact, toggleable list of actions or options triggered by a button. Dropdown menus are often used to conserve space by grouping related commands or providing actions within constrained layouts like tables.
a11yNotes: Tab and Shift+Tab move through menu items
Escape key closes the menu
Move focus to the first focusable item in the menu when it opens
Use native elements (buttons or links) inside the menu — do not assign extra ARIA roles

components.name: Footer
components.description: A persistent section placed at the bottom of a page that typically includes branding, legal disclaimers, and navigation links. Footers help provide key context, attribution, and site-wide resources, especially in web applications.
a11yNotes: Use <footer> element or role='contentinfo' for landmark navigation
Wrap related footer links in <nav> elements with descriptive aria-labels
Ensure text and logos meet WCAG contrast ratios and support high contrast mode
Consider adding a skip link to footer on long, scroll-heavy pages

components.name: Horizontal Navigation
components.description: A top-level navigation bar that allows users to move between major sections of an application or site. Typically placed at the top of the screen, it may include branding, navigation links, dropdowns, global search, notifications, and user profile actions.
a11yNotes: Use <nav> landmarks with descriptive aria-labels if multiple navs exist
Add aria-current='page' to the link for the current page
Include a 'Skip to main content' link as the first focusable element for keyboard users
Ensure responsive (mobile) menu is fully operable via keyboard and trap focus when open

components.name: Input
components.description: A single-line text field used to collect user input. Inputs are commonly used in forms, search bars, and interactive flows where users need to enter data or free-form text.
a11yNotes: Each input must have a label associated using for/id
Use aria-describedby to associate instructions and error messages
Indicate required fields in label text and optionally with the native required attribute
Use appropriate input types (e.g., email, date) to match expected data and aid validation

components.name: Single-Select Listbox
components.description: A vertically structured menu that allows users to select a single item from a list. Commonly used in forms and menus, single-select listboxes are foundational UI components used in dropdowns, comboboxes, and navigation patterns.
a11yNotes: Use Up/Down arrow keys to navigate between options in the listbox
Use aria-selected='true' on the selected option
Optional: support type-to-search within listbox if implemented
Press Enter or Space to select (or toggle) focused option

components.name: Pagination
components.description: A navigation component that divides content into multiple pages. It includes controls to move forward, backward, or jump to specific pages, helping users efficiently navigate large data sets or content collections.
a11yNotes: Use aria-current='page' to indicate the current page to screen readers
Use <ul> for pagination list so screen readers can announce number of items
Use native disabled attribute on non-actionable pagination controls
Use Tab to navigate between pagination controls and Enter to activate

components.name: Panel
components.description: A modal or persistent section used to display supplementary content, often overlaid on the main interface. Panels are commonly used for help content, side actions, or detailed views and can include interactive elements such as buttons and links.
a11yNotes: Trap keyboard focus inside the panel when open
Escape key must close the panel and return focus to trigger
Use aria-labelledby and aria-describedby to announce panel title and content
Use aria-modal='true' and prevent interaction with background content

components.name: Radio Button
components.description: A form control that allows users to select exactly one option from a group. Used when options are mutually exclusive.
a11yNotes: Wrap radio buttons in a <fieldset> with a <legend> to describe the group
Use arrow keys to move focus and selection within the group (wraps around)
Ensure only one radio can be selected per group using a shared name attribute
Associate each radio input with a clickable <label> using for and id

components.name: Select
components.description: A form input that allows users to choose a single option from a dropdown menu. Select components are commonly used in forms to save space while providing a clear and efficient selection process.
a11yNotes: Associate each <select> with a <label> using for and id attributes
Use a descriptive first option if it acts as a placeholder
Use ↑/↓ to navigate, and Home/End to jump to first/last option
Screen readers announce selected option automatically in native <select>

components.name: Switch
components.description: A binary toggle control that allows users to turn an option on or off. Commonly used in settings, preferences, and account configurations to quickly enable or disable a feature.
a11yNotes: Provide a clear, descriptive label indicating what the switch controls
Use role='switch' so screen readers announce 'on' and 'off' states
Press Space to toggle the switch (per native checkbox behavior)
Ensure on/off state is visually distinguishable without relying on color alone

components.name: Table
components.description: A structured layout used to organize and display information in rows and columns. Tables are commonly used for presenting data sets, summaries, or comparisons in a static, read-only format.
a11yNotes: Add scope='col' or scope='row' to <th> elements for accessible header-cell associations
Include a visually hidden <caption> that describes the table's purpose and structure
Ensure responsive design preserves table structure and keyboard/screen reader access on small screens
Use id and headers attributes to associate cells with row/column headers in complex tables
